Install the latest version of the tidyverse with:

```{r}
#| eval: false
install.packages("tidyverse")
```

Load the tidyverse with:

```{r}
library("tidyverse")
```

Did you notice?

## conflicted package

You may have noticed this message:

```bash
â„¹ Use the conflicted package to force all conflicts to become errors
```

tidyverse 2.0.0 now advertises the [conflicted package](https://conflicted.r-lib.org/).

Packages can have conflicts (i.e., contain functions of the same name). Normally, the package loaded last "wins" and masks (overrides) the other function, resulting in confusing errors.

```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(MASS)

select
```

With conflicted, you get an explicit error:

```{r}
#| error: true
library(conflicted)
library(dplyr)
library(MASS)

select
```

It asks you to either identify the namespace for each call:

```{r}
#| eval: false
dplyr::select
```

Or, declare a preference with `conflicts_prefer()`:

```{r}
#| eval: false
conflicts_prefer(dplyr::filter)
```

That way you know there's a problem and how to resolve it.
